headline: Alphabet earnings, Eli Lilly Q4 results, ADP data: What to Watch
summary: Asking for a Trend Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, February 4, including earnings results from Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Qualcomm (QCOM), Eli Lilly (LLY), and Novo Nordisk (NVO), and private employment data out from ADP. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Qualcomm Expands Beyond Handsets With Open RAN AI And Auto Growth
summary: Qualcomm (NasdaqGS:QCOM) is working with Rakuten Mobile and 1Finity to expand Open RAN networks using Qualcomm platforms. The company has launched an edge AI startup initiative across the Asia Pacific region. ECARX has selected Qualcomm's Snapdragon Elite platform for its next generation automotive computing, highlighted at CES. For Qualcomm, best known for its smartphone chips and connectivity solutions, these moves point to a broader role across telecom infrastructure, AI at the edge, and...

headline: Qualcomm: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the San Diego-based company said it had profit of $2.78. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense and non-recurring costs, came to $3.50 per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Qualcomm: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: On a per-share basis, the San Diego-based company said it had profit of $2.78. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense and non-recurring costs, came to $3.50 per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations.

headline: Qualcomm shares slide as memory chip shortage hits smartphone market
summary: Chip supplier Qualcomm forecast second-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, expecting a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales.  The results from San Diego, California-based Qualcomm come at a time when global electronics supply ​chains are grappling with an acute shortage of memory chips - an essential fixture across devices from smartphones to data centers.  Qualcomm shares were down 9% in ‌after-hours trading after the results.

content.title: Qualcomm shares slide as memory chip shortage hits smartphone market
content.summary: Chip supplier Qualcomm forecast second-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, expecting a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales.  The results from San Diego, California-based Qualcomm come at a time when global electronics supply ​chains are grappling with an acute shortage of memory chips - an essential fixture across devices from smartphones to data centers.  Qualcomm shares were down 9% in ‌after-hours trading after the results.

headline: Qualcomm Earnings Release Available on Company’s Investor Relations Website
summary: SAN DIEGO, February 04, 2026--Qualcomm Incorporated (NASDAQ: QCOM) today announced the Company’s financial results for its first quarter of fiscal 2026 through an earnings release that is available on the Qualcomm Investor Relations website at https://investor.qualcomm.com/financial-information. The earnings release will also be furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on a Form 8-K and will be available on the SEC website at http://www.sec.gov.

content.title: Qualcomm Earnings Release Available on Company’s Investor Relations Website

The earnings release will also be furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on a Form 8-K and will be available on the SEC website at http://www.sec.gov.

headline: Qualcomm stock dips as CEO flags memory constraints for handset business
summary: Investing.com -- Qualcomm Incorporated (NASDAQ:QCOM) reported record quarterly revenue for the start of fiscal 2026, yet its shares tumbled 6.6% in after-hours trading on Wednesday. Investors reacted sharply to a cautious outlook that overshadowed a significant beat on both the top and bottom lines. “We are pleased to deliver strong quarterly results, with record total company revenues,” said Cristiano Amon, President and CEO of Qualcomm Incorporated. headline: No Surprises In Qualcomm’s (NASDAQ:QCOM) Q4 Sales Numbers But Stock Drops
summary: Wireless chipmaker Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 5% year on year to $12.25 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $10.6 billion was less impressive, coming in 4.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.50 per share was 2.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: No Surprises In Qualcomm’s (NASDAQ:QCOM) Q4 Sales Numbers But Stock Drops
content.summary: Wireless chipmaker Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 5% year on year to $12.25 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $10.6 billion was less impressive, coming in 4.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.50 per share was 2.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Arm Holdings shares fall as licensing sales miss estimates
summary: Shares of Arm Holdings fell on Wednesday as its licensing revenues slightly missed Wall Street estimates, despite a push by ​the company to boost the segment with new chip technology designs.  The company forecast fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by demand for its energy-efficient chip designs used in artificial ‌intelligence applications from data centers to smartphones.  But the company's miss on licensing revenues and results from chip supplier Qualcomm - which forecast results below estimates  as it expects a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales - may have prompted the share fall, analysts said.

content.title: Arm Holdings shares fall as licensing sales miss estimates
content.summary: Shares of Arm Holdings fell on Wednesday as its licensing revenues slightly missed Wall Street estimates, despite a push by ​the company to boost the segment with new chip technology designs.  The company forecast fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by demand for its energy-efficient chip designs used in artificial ‌intelligence applications from data centers to smartphones.  But the company's miss on licensing revenues and results from chip supplier Qualcomm - which forecast results below estimates  as it expects a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales - may have prompted the share fall, analysts said.
